detaileddescription.para: The right and bottom sides of the box are darker than the top and left sides to produce a shadow effect and make the box look like it is raised slightly above the surrounding surface.
The border is a bevelled to give it a 3D effect. The border is uniform in appearance on all four sides. This is the default appearance.
No border.
Set the width of each button based on the standard width.
Set the width of each button based on the width of the widest button.
Set the width of each button to accommodate the label.
Round cap mode.
Butt cap mode.
Square cap mode.
Round join mode.
Miter join mode.
Bevel join mode.
Butt join mode.
Square join mode.
Horizontal alignment
Vertical alignment
Default miter limit used to calculate the angle cut off for miter joins.

briefdescription.para: Fills out the key_info struct with the current state of the keyboard.

parameterdescription.para: The key_info struct to fill out.
There was an error retrieving the key_info struct.

briefdescription.para: Provides a copy of the system keymap.

simplesect.para: You must free _map and _keyBuffer when you are done with them.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the system keymap structure.
A pointer containing the UTF-8 character encodings.

briefdescription.para: Fills out _id with the id of the currently attached keyboard.

parameterdescription.para: There was an error retrieving the keyboard id.

briefdescription.para: Gets the code of the requested modifier key from the system keymap.

parameterdescription.para: The modifier key to get from the system keymap.
A pointer to an int32 to store the key code.
There was an error retrieving the modifier key.

detaileddescription.para: If there are multiple mouses connected, this function return the speed from a random one.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of buttons of the mouse.

detaileddescription.para: If there are multiple mouses connected, the number of buttons for one of them picked at random will be returned.

briefdescription.para: Gets a bitmap of each modifier key pressed down and each active keyboard lock.

detaileddescription.para:
Test the bitmap returned using a bit mask composed of the following modifier key constants:
B_CAPS_LOCK
B_COMMAND_KEY
B_CONTROL_KEY
B_MENU_KEY
B_NUM_LOCK
B_OPTION_KEY
B_SCROLL_LOCK
B_SHIFT_KEY

You may use a bit mask of 0 to test that no modifier keys are pressed. If it is important to know if the left or right modifier key is pressed down you can use the following additional constants:
B_LEFT_SHIFT_KEY
B_RIGHT_SHIFT_KEY
B_LEFT_CONTROL_KEY
B_RIGHT_CONTROL_KEY
B_LEFT_OPTION_KEY
B_RIGHT_OPTION_KEY
B_LEFT_COMMAND_KEY
B_RIGHT_COMMAND_KEY

simplesect.para: A bitmap containing each active modifier keys and locks.

detaileddescription.para:
Pass in a bit mask containing the following constants:
B_CAPS_LOCK
B_NUM_LOCK
B_SCROLL_LOCK
The constants present in the bit mask will turn the lock on, those absent will turn the lock off. Pass 0 in to turn off all locks.

parameterdescription.para: A bitmap of lock keys to set.

briefdescription.para: Set the modifier key to the specified code in the system keymap.

parameterdescription.para: The modifier key to set in the system keymap.
The key code to set the modifier key to.

briefdescription.para: Defines standard interface definitions for controls.
